text: Frederic Ogden Nash (August 19, 1902 â€“ May 19, 1971) was an American poet. His poetry is thought by many people to be very funny.Academy of American Poets biography Nash was born in Rye, New York on August 19, 1902. In 1932, he joined the staff of The New Yorker. He died of Crohn's disease on May 19, 1971 in Baltimore, Maryland. == Related pages == *List of poets from the United States == References == Category:1902 births Category:1971 deaths Category:American poets Category:Disease-related deaths in Maryland Category:Writers from New York (state) Category:People from Rye, New York Category:Deaths from Crohn's disease
title: Ogden Nash
